subject: Re: Allophones Sweep Using SoundSoap2
author: Stefan
full_text:
Hi Margret,

sounds very interesting, although I wasn't able to hear the entire 
message, maybe because it's spoken very fast. But generally it's an 
interesting approach to include the experimenter in the process of 
EVP generation.

Stefan

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@...> 
wrote:
>
> Hi Stefan, et al.  I just ran a test session by dropping the Speak 
Jet Allophones WAV into 
> SoundSoap2.  I pressed play, then used my cursor to sweep back and 
forth through the 
> file.  I was essentially trying to replicate something similar to a 
manual radio sweep using 
> the tones.  I immediately received two direct, relevant responses 
to my questions, which 
> really surprised me!
> 
> In the first, I asked, "How does this work?" The reply is, "I have 
to say the people are 
> talking, but I don't really care."  LOL - guess I've been told.  ;0)
> 
> In the second, I asked for a name and was told, "It's Patrick."  
This really surprised me as 
> Patrick (along with David and a female I have never been able to 
identify) is the name of 
> one of my tech helpers who speaks to me mostly through the MiniBox, 
but also has come 
> through during radio sweeps. 
> 
> The last message was a comment I don't quite understand, "I'm in 
contact with 
> [counterfeits or counterbase.]"  Whatever that means.
> 
> Anyway, I thought I share this discovery about the SoundSoap2/
allophones combo with 
> the group because it appears to also have potential for receiving 
communication, and I 
> figured some of you might want to try it as well.
> 
> Margaret
